Está lleno de bugs, el matchmaking a veces no es el mejor y es un poco toxica la gente con la que jugas, pero es como la merca, una vez que la probas cuesta salir.
La mejor rehab que podes hacer es aprender a jugar y con amigos es mas divertido, aunque se puede jugar tranquilamente por cuenta propia.
Lo mas determinante son las habilidades porque dictan como vas a jugar, para los survis se podria decir que los personajes son skins de por si, porque se puede desbloquear todas las habilidades de cada personaje y aprovecharlas para usar en otros (perks enseñables), aunque eso nos lleve 3 mil horas hacerlo con todos. Los asesinos tambien pueden usar todas las habilidades (una vez aprendidas) pero ademas tienen su propio ataque especial, haciendo que cada partida sea diferente.
Para quienes recien comienzan recomiendo que se centren en un principio a reparar y llevarse bien con los skill checks, un buen dlc para eso es el Spark of Madness con su personaje Feng Min.

Getting to bond with my friends and finally having a co-op game to play with people has been really, truly lovely. 

Yeah sure, the game experiences bugs sometimes, getting the balance between the different killers is hard and some people can be a bit aggravating to play with/against.

But this game has been a lot of fun to play with friends and makes me smile more than it upsets me. In that sense, it's a credit to the developers. Thank you for giving me this opportunity.
very fun game.very fun to be toxic.i recommend game.

(edit: hate this game not playing it again)

This game had always been on the back of mind, really just started with H20delirious playing the game, but I never got a chance to ever play the game. But Just last year, one of my friends were playing it a lot, so much that it urged me to buy the game and try it out. It was the best purchase of my life, i would play and play for hours, the game had many aspects of horror while still being very fun and hilarious at some times. eventually a few months later I almost forgot about the game, but the same friend who was the one who referred me to buy Dead by Daylight, brought me back in and I never had so much fun, it really goes to show the work of the BEhavior team, I have a good computer, but I'm surprise they made it that almost most people despite their PC can run the best quality graphics. I need more of this game, it's a great game and it was hard to find critics to put in this review, While this is more an personal review, I would recommend this game to everyone, if features horror and survival if your into that stuff, you could either co-op online or with friends, or play as the killer and sacrifice all survivors. 10/10 Game.

This game is a lot of fun, and is worth every penny you put on it from base game, and dlcs to skins. Once you understand the game better and you are able to identify what makes the game really fun you`ll have a lot more fun than just pursuing either escape at all costs or killing every survivor.

Most of the negative reviews are from players who tried to play killer as far as I can tell. Reason is why they don`t get their 4 kills per match and complain about it. Even though DBD has a "main goal" which is to escape or kill, the side goals are what makes this game so fun to play and enjoy. As killer you have an infinity amount of builds to try out with different perks and addons that can spike your gameplay from boring META-PLAY to EXTREMELY-FUN gameplay, even if you dont get any kills. That`s something that only comes after you understand the game enough to see that finishing a match in 5s before a single gen is done, isn`t what this game is about. Rather the way you mindgame survivors, how cool and fun the chases are, the outplaying some stronger survivors, and many other aspects that are better than simply killing are way more rewarding than the "pre-set" goal thrown by developers.

The same goes for survivors, you have so many perks to try on, obviously there are 6 perks that are insanely strong and most of playerbase who are not creative with their gameplay are bound to use those perks because they are META and that will get em closer to escape. However if you look around you can go from quad stunning the killer builds to just get some laughs to gen rush builds. There is so much to play around in this game that you`d be amused on how many hours you`d have to put on it to actually achieve all of it.

I`m barely on my 446hrs and I`m considered a baby player still, although I`ve been rank 1 for a long time on survivor and rank 4 on killer (which I play a lot less), mainly because I studied a lot of streamers and youtubers and practiced before getting into the game with friends in custom matches. 

And that`s when we get to the ranking problem. Ranking is extremely easy and that`s a big problem in the game but also fun, if you don`t care about it. I always have fun getting some very unskilled players at red ranks, you feel like you have to protect them or just get some really good laugh from their silly mistakes.

In the end, and that`s obviously the way I treat the game and think about it. The fun of Dead by Daylight is the period during the match rather than it`s outcome. If you got 0 kills you can still have fun, if you don`t escape you can still have fun. There will be times when people play boring, and that`s fine, not everyone has the same playstyle or mindset. But you can be sure that you`ll have way more fun if you change your mindset and become a better player if you get out of meta and experiment with the game instead of caring about ranking or deranking.

100% buy the game and all dlcs. Worth the price and devs are always active and most of the time they attend to community feedback, unless it would change their vision over the game which they clearly don`t want to. If their vision of the game isn`t good for you don`t attempt it. If it pleases you than this is a solid game for you.

Tis a two Sided game. You can Experience the Power roll for a Op Killer or the Thrill of Surviving with friends. Become Good enough  with the power of Friendship and have the "turntables", becoming the Power roll as Survivor friends.
The game is repetitive but in a fun way, getting better at killing/surviving is necessary to move up the ranks and become your ultimate form!
